block.name: TRX Burst Interface
block.doc:
OsmoTRX like UDP burst interface for external applications.
There are two UDP connections, where each message carries one radio burst with header. Give a base port B (5700 by default). One connection at port P=B+100+2 is used for sending received bursts to an external application. Another one at port P=B+2 is used to obtain to be transmitted bursts.
Received burst format: 1 byte timeslot index 4 bytes GSM frame number, big endian 1 byte RSSI in -dBm 2 bytes correlator timing offset in 1/256 symbol steps, 2's-comp, big endian 148 bytes soft symbol estimates, 0 -> definite "0", 255 -> definite "1"
To be transmitted burst format: 1 byte timeslot index 4 bytes GSM frame number, big endian 1 byte transmit level wrt ARFCN max, -dB (attenuation) 148 bytes output symbol values, 0 & 1
